unnormalised: New bridge project in Guwahati faces delays. Construction on the much-awaited Bharalu river bridge is facing a setback, mainly due to issues with land acquisition. The initial plan was to have the bridge completed by 31/12/2024, but officials now estimate a delay of at least 6 months. The bridge is designed to be 2.5 km long and 12 m wide, hoping to ease traffic congestion in the city center.

The bridge is designed to be two point five kilometer long and twelve meter wide, hoping to ease traffic congestion in the city center.

unnormalised: According to sources, only 60% of the required land has been acquired. Compensation negotiations are still ongoing with several families. "We are hoping to get this resolved ASAP," he added.
